responseData.title: History TV
responseData.shortDescription: The historical events, people, and dramas that shaped our world. This collection of full-length documentaries has been drawn from a variety of international sources and produced by top journalists and documentary filmmakers.
responseData.uniqueDescription: The historical events, people, and dramas that shaped our world. This collection of full-length documentaries has been drawn from a variety of international sources and produced by top journalists and documentary filmmakers.

episodeList.title: Ancient Inventions of War
episodeList.shortDescription: Examines the search for the ultimate weapon, as well as the ability of doctors to repair the damage such weapons cause.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Examine the search for the ultimate weapon, as well as the ability of doctors to repair the damage such weapons cause. Byzantine flame throwers, Chinese poison gas and successful surgical techniques as complex as brain surgery are a few of the Ancient Inventions inspired by warfare.

episodeList.title: Ramesses II: The Great Journey
episodeList.shortDescription: After a prestigious reign of 67 years, Ramesses II dies at the exceptional age of 92.  Now, European travelers aim to reach the burial chamber that houses his body and all his treasures starting an archeological investigation through time.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: More than 3200 years ago, under the reign of Ramesses the Second, pharaoh of the New Empire’s 19th dynasty, Egypt is living the final hours of its golden age. After a prestigious reign of 67 years, the powerful pharaoh dies at the exceptional age of 92. He becomes for all time the legendary “Ramesses the Great.” His mummy is interred in the heart of the Valley of the Kings, on the west bank of Thebes. This marks the beginning of his Great Journey towards the afterlife, where he will meet with eternity. But only on one condition: that his tomb and mummified remains are preserved for all time. In the 19th century several European travelers visit the tomb of the illustrious king. Their aim is to reach the burial chamber that houses his body and all his treasures. Now begins a fascinating archeological investigation through time and space, which reveals the rocambolesque story of the “after-life” of Ramesses the Second.

episodeList.title: After Braveheart
episodeList.shortDescription: Ever wondered what happened after the epic events that are portrayed in the Hollywood movie Braveheart? A new docudrama reveals the untold story of how a Scottish army tried to drive the English out of Ireland 700 years ago.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Hollywood movie Braveheart ends with the Battle of Bannockburn, in which the Scots finally defeated their English oppressors in 1314. It was a monumental victory that should have ensured Scottish freedom – but it didn’t. Even after Bannockburn, Scotland’s king Robert Bruce and his brother Edward remained uneasy about the threat of a renewed English invasion. The best form of defense was attack. In a real-life “Game of Thrones”, they decided to invade Ireland and make Edward high king there. In this way they would unite the Celtic nations and drive the hated English back to their homeland.

episodeList.title: Promises and Betrayal
episodeList.shortDescription: This is a story of how deception and conflicting promises ignited a legacy of bloodshed in Middle East. Avi Shlaim, Professor of International Relations at Oxford University, calls it 'one of the best documentaries on the Middle East I have ever seen'.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: This is a story of how deception and conflicting promises ignited a legacy of bloodshed in Middle East. Avi Shlaim, Professor of International Relations at Oxford University, calls it 'one of the best documentaries on the Middle East I have ever seen'.

episodeList.title: Ellis Island: A History of the American Dream
episodeList.shortDescription: About 12 million emigrants landed on Ellis Island at the turn of the 20th century. Upon their arrival their fates were hung in the balance - would they be permitted to enter the United States or be turned away at the gates?
episodeList.uniqueDescription:
At the turn of the 20th century, they crossed the Atlantic Ocean leaving a miserable, persecuted or uncertain existence in Europe for New York’s wide avenues, Brooklyn’s profitable gambling dens or Hollywood’s Highlights.
Like 12 million other emigrants, they landed on Ellis Island, first outpost of the American federal immigration station in the Upper New York Bay, ultimate gateway to the United-States of America. In those decisive hours, when their fates do not belong to them and are in someone else’s hands, where federal immigration inspectors decide who is approved and who is sent home, the Melting Pot was born, built up of the teeming masses arriving from the Old Continent.
Rewriting the story of some exemplary destinies for a few, among the anonymous and long-forgotten voices of the other immigrants, we will relate the greatest European tragedies of the first half of the 20th century to an ambivalent America, which welcomes through successive waves, an immigration who will recreate and embody the American Dream.

episodeList.title: Spirit of the Pony Express
episodeList.shortDescription: With forces threatening to tear America apart at the beginning of the Civil War, one small enterprise united and held the land together. Filmed for the 150th anniversary, this is the story of the Pony Express, one of America's most celebrated institutions
episodeList.uniqueDescription: With forces threatening to tear America apart at the beginning of the Civil War, one small enterprise united and held the land together. Filmed for the 150th anniversary, this is the story of the Pony Express, one of America's most celebrated institutions.

episodeList.title: North Korea: The Greatest Illusion
episodeList.shortDescription: After years of negotiations, Michaël Sztanke and Julien Alric secured a visa to get into North Korea. After being censored on their first trip, they returned to find out how North-Korean people live? What is the real nature of this political regime?
episodeList.uniqueDescription: After years of negotiations, Michaël Sztanke and Julien Alric secured a visa to get into North Korea. After being censored on their first trip, they returned to find out how North-Korean people live? What is the real nature of this political regime?

episodeList.title: The Secret of Mona Lisa
episodeList.shortDescription: The Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci is the most famous painting in the world. What is the secret behind the “real” Mona Lisa? Who was she really? Watch this “detective story” about the search for the truth about the smiling woman.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci is the most famous painting in the world. What is the secret behind the “real” Mona Lisa? Who was she really? Watch this “detective story” about the search for the truth about the smiling woman.

episodeList.title: The Diva Mummy
episodeList.shortDescription: Scientists perform an autopsy on the best preserved mummy ever discovered: that of a Han aristocrat named Lady Dai. More than 2000 years after her death her flesh is still resilient and the blood in her veins is still red. What can she tell us about life
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Scientists perform an autopsy on the best preserved mummy ever discovered: that of a Han aristocrat named Lady Dai. More than 2000 years after her death her flesh is still resilient and the blood in her veins is still red. What can she tell us about life in ancient China?

episodeList.title: China VS USA: Empires at War
episodeList.shortDescription: China keeps claiming sovereignty over Taiwan. The USA believes the Tech industry of the island nation needs to be protected. Prominent international experts from both sides, China vs. USA, Empires At War explores all the issues that could lead to war.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: China keeps claiming sovereignty over Taiwan. The USA believes the Tech industry of the island nation needs to be protected. Prominent international experts from both sides, China vs. USA, Empires At War explores all the issues that could lead to war.

episodeList.title: Kim Jong Un: Unauthorized Biography
episodeList.shortDescription: He is the living god of the 9th nuclear power of the world, raised in secrecy to take over the commands of the North Korean regime. Investigators travel to Switzerland, the USA and Asia to find those who really know Kim and try to profile the new leader.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: He is the living god of the 9th nuclear power of the world, raised in secrecy to take over the commands of the North Korean regime. Investigators travel to Switzerland, the USA and Asia to find those who really know Kim and try to profile the new leader.

episodeList.title: Broadside: Emerging Empires Collide
episodeList.shortDescription: Throughout the 17th century, the Dutch and English fought desperate wars over which country would dominate world trade for the next two centuries. They waged massive sea battles in Europe and embarked on violent raids in Asia, Africa and North America.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Throughout the 17th century, the Dutch and English fought desperate wars over which country would dominate world trade for the next two centuries. They waged massive sea battles in Europe and embarked on violent raids in Asia, Africa and North America.

episodeList.title: Codebreaker
episodeList.shortDescription: In 1952, the brilliant mathematician, Alan Turing, was in torment. Although he helped crack the impossible German Enigma machine and changed computing forever, he was disgraced for being a homosexual in a time when homosexual acts were illegal.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: In 1952, the brilliant mathematician, Alan Turing, was in torment. Although he helped crack the impossible German Enigma machine and changed computing forever, he was disgraced for being a homosexual in a time when homosexual acts were illegal.

episodeList.title: Battle of The Somme
episodeList.shortDescription: The Battle of the Somme was a bloodbath, a modern battle of such prehistoric brutality that its horror is hard to comprehend. Brave men eagerly volunteered to fight for honor, only to be used as cannon fodder by their military and political leaders.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Battle of the Somme was a bloodbath, a modern battle of such prehistoric brutality that its horror is hard to comprehend. Brave men eagerly volunteered to fight for honor, only to be used as cannon fodder by their military and political leaders.

episodeList.title: Tobago 1677
episodeList.shortDescription: Explore a dramatic moment in Caribbean and world history, when European nations battled for domination of the New World. Three centuries later, examine the remains of twenty French & Dutch battleships that now lie at the bottom of Scarborough Harbor.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Explore a dramatic moment in Caribbean and world history, when European nations battled for domination of the New World. Three centuries later, examine the remains of twenty French & Dutch battleships that now lie at the bottom of Scarborough Harbor.

episodeList.title: Steve Jobs: His Story
episodeList.shortDescription: Steve Jobs revolutionized the face of technology as we know it. What made this visionary genius tick? Through interviews with close friends and colleagues, Steve Jobs: His Story provides an in-depth profile of the man who redefined technology.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Steve Jobs revolutionized the face of technology as we know it. What made this visionary genius tick? Through interviews with close friends and colleagues, Steve Jobs: His Story provides an in-depth profile of the man who redefined technology.

episodeList.title: The Battle of Hood and Bismarck
episodeList.shortDescription: The voyage to find history's two greatest battleships. It was the greatest sea battle of World War Two. It ended in the destruction of the two finest warships the world has ever seen and claimed the lives of almost 3,500 men.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The voyage to find history's two greatest battleships. It was the greatest sea battle of World War Two. It ended in the destruction of the two finest warships the world has ever seen and claimed the lives of almost 3,500 men.

episodeList.title: Angle of Attack
episodeList.shortDescription: 100-years of naval aviation, from wobbly gliders and the first shipboard landing in 1911 to modern supersonic jets and unmanned aerial vehicles. The film deftly interweaves archival footage, interviews with historical and military experts.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: 100-years of naval aviation, from wobbly gliders and the first shipboard landing in 1911 to modern supersonic jets and unmanned aerial vehicles. The film deftly interweaves archival footage, interviews with historical and military experts.

episodeList.title: The Relief of Belsen
episodeList.shortDescription: Belsen Concentration Camp. Its liberation from Nazis did not bring safety to its 60,000 innocent victims.  This award-winning movie evokes the actual events that transpired at Belsen as the British fought typhus, starvation, and their own humanity.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Belsen Concentration Camp. Its liberation from Nazis did not bring safety to its 60,000 innocent victims.  This award-winning movie evokes the actual events that transpired at Belsen as the British fought typhus, starvation, and their own humanity.

episodeList.title: Breaking the Taboo
episodeList.shortDescription: The War on Drugs has failed. After 50 years of prohibition, illicit drugs are now the third most valuable industry in the world after food and oil, all in the control of criminals. Drugs are cheaper and more available than ever, what is the answer?
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The War on Drugs has failed. After 50 years of prohibition, illicit drugs are now the third most valuable industry in the world after food and oil, all in the control of criminals. Drugs are cheaper and more available than ever, what is the answer?

episodeList.title: In Search of Mozart
episodeList.shortDescription: From an incredibly young age, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was able to play and compose the most complex and marvelous pieces in history.  This is his story of love and hardship, and his unique, unparalleled genius.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: From an incredibly young age, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was able to play and compose the most complex and marvelous pieces in history.  This is his story of love and hardship, and his unique, unparalleled genius.

episodeList.title: Curse of the Axe
episodeList.shortDescription: "Curse of the Axe" traces a groundbreaking investigation of a mysterious iron object which was buried in a Huron-Wendat village, 100 years before European contact. This discovery could rewrite American history forever.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: "Curse of the Axe" traces a groundbreaking investigation of a mysterious iron object which was buried in a Huron-Wendat village, 100 years before European contact. This discovery could rewrite American history forever.

episodeList.title: 9/11: The Falling Man
episodeList.shortDescription: It's one of the most unforgettable images from 9/11 - a photograph of a falling man, frozen in mid air, his body perfectly parallel with the twin towers.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: It's one of the most unforgettable images from 9/11 - a photograph of a falling man, frozen in mid air, his body perfectly parallel with the twin towers. The photo ran in newspapers across the world the following day and should have remained one of the defining images of the event. Instead, it was quickly airbrushed out of history. Why?

episodeList.title: Defusing Human Bombs
episodeList.shortDescription: Defusing Human Bombs is the incredible story of the Sabaoon School in Pakistan, which uses both psychology and religion to undo years of Taliban indoctrination in the hearts and minds of young boys training to become suicide bombers.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Defusing Human Bombs is the incredible story of the Sabaoon School in Pakistan, which uses both psychology and religion to undo years of Taliban indoctrination in the hearts and minds of young boys training to become suicide bombers.

episodeList.title: Secret Iraq
episodeList.shortDescription: The story of Iraq since it was invaded is one of the most complex, dramatic and bloody narratives that in modern history. Dozens of events that provoked headlines across the world compete for attention, yet the stories behind them remain largely untold.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The story of Iraq since it was invaded is one of the most complex, dramatic and bloody narratives that exists in modern history. Dozens of events that provoked headlines across the world compete for attention, yet the stories behind them remain largely untold.

episodeList.title: Carthage: The Roman Holocaust
episodeList.shortDescription: When Rome was still in its infancy, Carthage was the dominant power of the Mediterranean. As Rome grew, Carthage remained its only great rival. It was that rivalry that drove Rome to utterly destroy Carthage, and massacre its people.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: When Rome was still in its infancy, Carthage was the dominant power of the Mediterranean. As Rome grew, Carthage remained its only great rival. It was that rivalry that drove Rome to utterly destroy Carthage, and massacre its people.

episodeList.title: Assault and Rescue: the Entebbe Raid
episodeList.shortDescription: The daring Israeli raid on Entebbe described in exclusive first-person accounts by the heroes who pulled off this impossible mission. Gripping re-enactments take you inside the assault that brought hostages of the highjacked flight to safety.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The daring Israeli raid on Entebbe described in exclusive first-person accounts by the heroes who pulled off this impossible mission. Gripping re-enactments take you inside the assault that brought nearly all of the hostages of the highjacked Air France Flight 139 to safety.

seriesList.title: Instruments of Death
seriesList.shortDescription: "Instruments of Death" is a six part series that examines the weapons of history's deadliest wars.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: "Instruments of Death" is a six part series that examines the weapons of history's deadliest wars.

episodeList.title: The Somme 1916
episodeList.shortDescription: Karl Ude-Martinez investigates weapons used during 1916's Battle of the Somme, including machine guns and poison gas
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Karl Ude-Martinez investigates weapons used during 1916's Battle of the Somme, including machine guns and poison gas. Episode 1 of "Instruments of Death".

episodeList.title: Battle of Towton 1461
episodeList.shortDescription: Presenters Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks continue their look at how weapons and body armor were developed, taking a look at the impact of the Battle of Towton during the War of the Roses.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Presenters Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks continue their look at how weapons and body armor were developed, taking a look at the impact of the Battle of Towton during the War of the Roses. Episode 2 of "Instruments of Death".

episodeList.title: Battle of Waterloo 1815
episodeList.shortDescription: Kevin Hicks and Karl Ude-Martinez test a cannon, grenade, and Brown Bess musket as they explore what it was like to face a Napoleonic charge.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Kevin Hicks and Karl Ude-Martinez test a cannon, grenade, and Brown Bess musket as they explore what it was like to face a Napoleonic charge. Episode 3 of "Instruments of Death".

episodeList.title: The Battle of Watling Street AD 61
episodeList.shortDescription: Military combat specialists Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks investigate the British uprising against the Roman army, examining how swords, spears and body armor were developed. Plus, how battlefield wounds were treated on the front lines.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Military combat specialists Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks investigate the British uprising against the Roman army, examining how swords, spears and body armor were developed. Plus, how battlefield wounds were treated on the front lines. Episode 4 of "Instruments of Death".

episodeList.title: Battle of Hastings 1066
episodeList.shortDescription: Presenters Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks continue their look at how weapons and body armor were developed, investigating the part played by Danish battle axes, Saxon shields and Norman lances during the Battle of Hastings in 1066.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Presenters Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks continue their look at how weapons and body armor were developed, investigating the part played by Danish battle axes, Saxon shields and Norman lances during the Battle of Hastings in 1066. episodeList.title: Battle of Naseby 1645
episodeList.shortDescription: Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks explore how weapons and body armor were developed, beginning with a look at the impact of the 1645 Battle of Naseby during the English Civil War.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks explore how weapons and body armor were developed, beginning with a look at the impact of the 1645 Battle of Naseby during the English Civil War. Episode 6 of "Instruments of Death".

seriesList.title: Ancient History
seriesList.shortDescription: If you think you know the ancient world, think again. This series is packed full of surprising and little-known facts that throw new light on our understanding of ancient civilizations.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: If you think you know the ancient world, think again. This series is packed full of surprising and little-known facts that throw new light on our understanding of ancient civilizations.

episodeList.title: The Khufu Pyramid Revealed
episodeList.shortDescription: The Great Pyramids are the only wonder of the ancient world that still stand today, the greatest of which is the pyramid of Khufu. Many theories have been offered to explain its construction, but none as convincing or unique as this one.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Great Pyramids are the only wonder of the ancient world that still stand today, the greatest of which is the pyramid of Khufu. Many theories have been offered to explain its construction, but none as convincing or unique as this one.

episodeList.title: Vesuvius: Deadly Fury
episodeList.shortDescription: On the 24th August 79 AD, the eruption of Vesuvius eradicated the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Exactly what forces did our planet unleash to kill so many people?  Using modern science, the mysteries of the devastation are revealed.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: On the 24th August 79 AD, the eruption of Vesuvius eradicated the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Exactly what forces did our planet unleash to kill so many people?  Using modern science, the mysteries of the devastation are revealed.

episodeList.title: Beasts of the Roman Games
episodeList.shortDescription: The untold story of the Roman animal trade and the arena games. For over seven hundred years, the Romans trapped, transported and slaughtered wild and exotic animals in the Empire's arenas of death.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The untold story of the Roman animal trade and the arena games. For over seven hundred years, the Romans trapped, transported and slaughtered wild and exotic animals in the Empire's arenas of death.

episodeList.title: Mummies of the Taklamakan
episodeList.shortDescription: For ten years, a Franco-Chinese team has been excavating the Taklamakan desert. This quest takes us across the oases of the ancient Silk Road, a commercial caravan route along which Buddhism spread to China in the 1st century A.D.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: For ten years, a Franco-Chinese team has been excavating the Taklamakan desert. This quest takes us across the oases of the ancient Silk Road, a commercial caravan route along which Buddhism spread to China in the 1st century A.D.

episodeList.title: Stonehenge Revealed
episodeList.shortDescription: One of history's most enigmatic mysteries is unraveled in this fascinating special. Journey back in time to life in Neolithic Europe, 5000 years ago.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: One of history's most enigmatic mysteries is unraveled in this fascinating special. Journey back in time to life in Neolithic Europe, 5000 years ago. The result is a challenging and refreshing new theory about how our prehistoric ancestors came to terms with a changing world.

episodeList.title: Quest for the Lost Pharaoh
episodeList.shortDescription: Unraveling the tale of a priest and his family by following the clues left to us by the ancients, Vassil Dobrev will attempt to reconstruct the past in his quest for the lost pharaoh.   State of the art CGI brings the ancient necropolis to life.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Unraveling the tale of a priest and his family by following the clues left to us by the ancients, Vassil Dobrev will attempt to reconstruct the past in his quest for the lost pharaoh.   State of the art CGI brings the ancient necropolis to life.

episodeList.title: The Sacred Animals of the Pharaohs
episodeList.shortDescription: The animals of the Pharaohs were worshipped as sacred and immortalized in the stunning Egyptian artwork.  Explore this ancient world through the eyes of its animals, including crocodiles, hippos, various birds, and monkeys.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The animals of the Pharaohs were worshipped as sacred and immortalized in the stunning Egyptian artwork.  Explore this ancient world through the eyes of its animals, including crocodiles, hippos, various birds, and monkeys.

episodeList.title: Search for the Lost Treasure of Afghanistan
episodeList.shortDescription: It is the greatest ‘lost treasure’ in history: a mountain of gold and jewels reputed to be worth over $530 billion. Now, Tahir Shah is taking up the gauntlet to find the treasure of his ancestor—Ahmad Shah, the first king of Afghanistan.

seriesList.uniqueDescription: History may not be what we've learned. New information is brought to light in these eye-opening episodes that may change the way we think about our past.

episodeList.title: The Real History of England
episodeList.shortDescription: The Anglo-Saxon settlement of England marked a new age for Britain. But with new archeological evidence, the very identity of the Anglo-Saxons has come into question. Were they really invaders, or were they a part of British culture all along?
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Anglo-Saxon settlement of England marked a new age for Britain. But with new archeological evidence, the very identity of the Anglo-Saxons has come into question. Were they really invaders, or were they a part of British culture all along?

episodeList.uniqueDescription: In this roller coaster of a film, Tony Robinson’s hopes for hidden truths are constantly raised and dashed as he investigates the Masonic influence on past and present, and delves into the truth of their rituals and secrets.

episodeList.title: Robberies of the Century
episodeList.shortDescription: They used disguises, cunning and bravado. Some traveled through foreign lands, leading top detectives on a wild pursuit around the world. Some got away with millions, others captured within days.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: They used disguises, cunning and bravado. Some traveled through foreign lands, leading top detectives on a wild pursuit around the world. Some got away with millions, others captured within days.

episodeList.title: The Pilgrims: Journey into the Unknown
episodeList.shortDescription: For many Americans, the journey of the Mayflower symbolizes the birth of their nation. But what more is there to the story? How did the pilgrims’ persecuted religious community survive against all odds on their journey into the unknown?
episodeList.uniqueDescription: For many Americans, the journey of the Mayflower symbolizes the birth of their nation. But what more is there to the story? How did the pilgrims’ persecuted religious community survive against all odds on their journey into the unknown?

episodeList.title: Royal Wreck of Gold
episodeList.shortDescription: When the steam clipper “The Royal Charter” was wrecked off the British coast, it took an unbelievable 460 passengers and 80 million Australian dollars with it. Now, for the first time, unearth the secrets of The Royal Charter.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: When the steam clipper “The Royal Charter” was wrecked off the British coast, it took an unbelievable 460 passengers and 80 million Australian dollars with it. Now, for the first time, unearth the secrets of The Royal Charter.

episodeList.title: The Year Without Summer
episodeList.shortDescription: Almost two hundred years ago, Mount Tambora in Eastern Indonesia unleashed the most deadly eruption in history, wiping out at least 117,000 people. However, the death toll continued to rise as it triggered worldwide climate change.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Almost two hundred years ago, Mount Tambora in Eastern Indonesia unleashed the most deadly eruption in history, wiping out at least 117,000 people. However, the death toll continued to rise as it triggered worldwide climate change.

episodeList.title: Breaking the Sound Barrier
episodeList.shortDescription: The international race for supersonic flight was won by the Americans in 1947. Designers, engineers and survivors of an elite group of pilots who risked life and limb in testing the prototype tell their story.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The international race for supersonic flight was won by the Americans in 1947. Designers, engineers and survivors of an elite group of pilots who risked life and limb in testing the prototype tell their story. They also comment on what they saw as an act of betrayal by the authorities who blew their dream of supersonic flight out of the sky.

episodeList.title: Head On Air Crash
episodeList.shortDescription: On November 12, 1996 two planes collided head on at 14,000 feet. There were no survivors. Using newspaper reports, official documents, and eyewitness accounts, Head On Air Crash pieces together the events of that fateful day.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: On November 12, 1996 two planes collided head on at 14,000 feet. There were no survivors. Using newspaper reports, official documents, and eyewitness accounts, Head On Air Crash pieces together the events of that fateful day.

episodeList.title: Asia's Titanic
episodeList.shortDescription: In 1987, the passenger ship Dona Paz collided with an oil tanker off Mindoro Island in the Philippines. It was the world’s worst peacetime maritime disaster since the Titanic. Yet the truth regarding the crash has been hidden, until now.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: In 1987, the passenger ship Dona Paz collided with an oil tanker off Mindoro Island in the Philippines. It was the world’s worst peacetime maritime disaster since the Titanic. Yet the truth regarding the crash has been hidden, until now.

episodeList.title: Arctic Manhunt
episodeList.shortDescription: In 1931, a stranger appeared out of nowhere in the Canadian Arctic. Months later, the North’s biggest manhunt was launched to find the elusive murderer and thief. The fugitive’s unknown identity died with him, never to be discovered—until now.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: In 1931, a stranger appeared out of nowhere in the Canadian Arctic. Months later, the North’s biggest manhunt was launched to find the elusive murderer and thief. The fugitive’s unknown identity died with him, never to be discovered—until now.

seriesList.title: Tales of the Living Dead
seriesList.shortDescription: This series of archaeological mysteries explores ancient murders using forensic science to try to solve the crime.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: This series of archaeological mysteries explores ancient murders using forensic science to try to solve the crime. The films are fast-paced with subtle reconstruction used to illustrate the stories. Graphics flesh out what the victim looked like and how they might have died which builds a picture of the environment in which the victim met their end.

episodeList.title: Dead Witch Resurrection
episodeList.shortDescription: 2,500 years ago, a woman was buried, possibly still alive, seemingly with her arms and legs tightly bound and with a strange metal collar around her neck. Archaeologist Andy Chapman was determined to get to the bottom of this ancient mystery.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: 2,500 years ago, a woman was buried, possibly still alive, seemingly with her arms and legs tightly bound and with a strange metal collar around her neck. Archaeologist Andy Chapman was determined to get to the bottom of this ancient mystery.

episodeList.title: Bog Body
episodeList.shortDescription: Denmark 1835. Danish peat diggers made a shocking discovery. They found the petrified body of a woman in a boggy marsh, pinned down underwater by wooden stakes. Archaeologist Lone Hvass investigates.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Denmark 1835. Danish peat diggers made a shocking discovery. They found the petrified body of a woman in a boggy marsh, pinned down underwater by wooden stakes. Archaeologist Lone Hvass investigates.

episodeList.title: Aztec Death
episodeList.shortDescription: The desolate but beautiful coastline of northern Chile harbours an ancient mystery. Here, thousands of years ago, a child died, was mummified and buried. Archaeologist Bernardo Arriaza turns to forensic science to build a picture.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The desolate but beautiful coastline of northern Chile harbours an ancient mystery. Here, thousands of years ago, a child died, was mummified and buried. Archaeologist Bernardo Arriaza turns to forensic science to build a picture.

episodeList.title: Unknown Soldier
episodeList.shortDescription: The mysterious case of a skeleton found buried in a Medieval cemetery smacks of a vicious and violent murder. The body was found in the quaint town of Lewes which lies nestled in the peaceful, rolling downs of southern England.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The mysterious case of a skeleton found buried in a Medieval cemetery smacks of a vicious and violent murder. The body was found in the quaint town of Lewes which lies nestled in the peaceful, rolling downs of southern England.

episodeList.title: Sea Spies

episodeList.title: Paulus the Defector
episodeList.shortDescription: Friedrich Paulus was an officer in the German military, attaining the rank of field marshal during World War II, and is best known for having commanded the Sixth Army's assault on Stalingrad. The battle ended in disaster for Nazi Germany with casualties r

The battle ended in disaster for Nazi Germany with casualties reaching as high as 740,000.

episodeList.title: Keitel the Lackey

episodeList.uniqueDescription: Wilhelm Keitel was a German field marshal and eventually became war minister. He was one of Germany's most senior military leaders, although many of his decisions were not his own.  After defying Hitler early on, he eventually bent to Hitler’s military wishes.

episodeList.title: Rommel the Desert Fox
episodeList.shortDescription: Erwin Rommel, the Desert Fox, was one of the most skilled commanders of desert warfare and is regarded as having been a humane and professional officer. He led his troops to victory without committing war crimes and even ignored orders to kill captured co
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Erwin Rommel, the Desert Fox, was one of the most skilled commanders of desert warfare and is regarded as having been a humane and professional officer. episodeList.title: Canaris the Spy
episodeList.shortDescription: Wilhelm Franz Canaris was a German admiral, head of the Abwehr, the German military intelligence service, from 1935 to 1944 and a member of the German Resistance.  Posing as a trusted man, he worked fervently to help overthrow Hitler’s regime.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Wilhelm Franz Canaris was a German admiral, head of the Abwehr, the German military intelligence service, from 1935 to 1944 and a member of the German Resistance.  Posing as a trusted man, he worked fervently to help overthrow Hitler’s regime.

episodeList.uniqueDescription: Colonel General Ernst Udet was the second-highest scoring German flying ace of World War I. seriesList.title: The First World War
seriesList.shortDescription: This stunning account of hostilities which offers new insight into one of the twentieth century's defining events For the first time, it offers a truly global vision of a conflict which is often misconceived as a prolonged skirmish on the Western Front.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: The popular view of the First World War is dominated by cliché. Young British soldiers, many of them budding poets, were led to early and ghastly deaths in muddy wastes by incompetent generals for reasons that were seemingly futile. Although clichés are not necessarily lies, they are at best a selective view of the truth. This is a stunning account of the hostilities which offers new insight into one of the defining events of the twentieth century. For the first time, it offers a truly global vision of a conflict which is often misconceived as a prolonged skirmish on the Western Front. Accessible, compelling and utterly convincing, this is modern history revealed at its finest.

episodeList.title: To Arms
episodeList.shortDescription: The Great War was came from extraordinarily complex origins. Seemingly insignificant local tensions in the Balkans exploded into The First World War.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Great War was came from extraordinarily complex origins. Seemingly insignificant local tensions in the Balkans exploded into The First World War.

episodeList.uniqueDescription: The German invasion of Belgium and France was brutal and fanned the flames of war.  It was only the beginning of the slaughter.

episodeList.uniqueDescription: The European Empires clashed all across the world, from the South Atlantic Seas to the plains of Africa.

episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Somme and Verdun saw carnage on an unprecedented scale, as armies fought to break the stalemate on the Western Front.

episodeList.title: Blockade
episodeList.shortDescription: The war at sea was every bit as bitter as the war on land. The battle at Jutland proved inconclusive, but the U-Boat menace threatened Britain as never before. Meanwhile America entered the war.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The war at sea was every bit as bitter as the war on land. The battle at Jutland proved inconclusive, but the U-Boat menace threatened Britain as never before. Meanwhile America entered the war.

episodeList.shortDescription: The effects of The Great War shattered nations, inspired mass mutinies by desperate troops, caused great upheaval on the home front and changed the world forever.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The effects of The Great War shattered nations, inspired mass mutinies by desperate troops, caused great upheaval on the home front and changed the world forever.

episodeList.title: Germany's Last Gamble

episodeList.uniqueDescription: Over 1 million German troops were committed to Kaiserschlacht – the last great offensive of the war, while conflict still raged on many other fronts.

episodeList.title: War Without End

episodeList.uniqueDescription: The dramatic Allied victory at Amiens led to victory in just 100 days and the signing of a bitterly resented peace, while other nations stumbled towards their own ceasefire agreements.

seriesList.title: WWI: The War to End All Wars
seriesList.shortDescription: On July 28, 1914 Austria-Hungary declared war on Serbia following the assassination of Archduke Ferdinand. The 4 years following this declaration would ignite the entire globe in war and be ranked among the deadliest conflicts in human history.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: On July 28, 1914 Austria-Hungary declared war on Serbia following the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria. The 4 years following this declaration would ignite the entire globe in war and be ranked among the deadliest conflicts in human history, with over 16 million deaths and 20 million wounded.

episodeList.title: War Horse: The Real Story
episodeList.shortDescription: For centuries, Britain’s cavalry had been one of the staples of its military force. But with the dawn of World War I, a bloody end was beginning for the war horse. Go inside the real history of the WWI British Cavalry’s heroic last charge.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: For centuries, Britain’s cavalry had been one of the staples of its military force. But with the dawn of World War I, a bloody end was beginning for the war horse. Go inside the real history of the WWI British Cavalry’s heroic last charge.

episodeList.title: Battle Of The Somme: The True Story
episodeList.shortDescription: The Battle of the Somme was the bloodiest day in the history of England. Since then, debate has raged over the legitimacy of the only combat footage of the battle. Now, a team of investigators is using science to solve this 90-year-old mystery.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Battle of the Somme was the bloodiest day in the history of England. Since then, debate has raged over the legitimacy of the only combat footage of the battle. Now, a team of investigators is using science to solve this 90-year-old mystery.

episodeList.title: Breathing Fire: Secret Weapon of the Somme
episodeList.shortDescription: Join a group of archeologists and engineers as they excavate the battle-site of the Somme in search of a giant flamethrower lost for almost a century, and attempt to rebuild it. This mechanical dragon will roar once more.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Join a group of archeologists and engineers as they excavate the battle-site of the Somme in search of a giant flamethrower lost for almost a century, and attempt to rebuild it. This mechanical dragon will roar once more.

seriesList.title: World War II: The Last Heroes
seriesList.shortDescription: Meet the last living heroes of World War II and hear their stories—not in the words of generals and historians—but in their own words.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: World War II was the world’s darkest hour, filled with war’s horrors and unimaginable cruelty. Meet the last living heroes of this gruesome battle, and hear their stories—not in the words of generals and historians—but in their own words. Using actual footage from the war, as well as real weaponry to depict what they went through, these men and women will tell you of their trials as no one else can.

episodeList.title: D-Day
episodeList.shortDescription: In June 1944, hundreds of thousands of young men gathered on the south coast of England, ready for war. Their destination was the beaches of Normandy, where one of World War II’s most brutal battles took place, and the tide of the war turned.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: In June 1944, hundreds of thousands of young men gathered on the south coast of England, ready for war. Their destination was the beaches of Normandy, where one of World War II’s most brutal battles took place, and the tide of the war turned.

episodeList.title: The Battle for Caen
episodeList.shortDescription: Mere hours after victory on the beaches of D-Day, the allies move into Normandy. Their goal was to seize the city of Caen, but with Germans fighting for every step of countryside, their invasion soon became a nightmare.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Mere hours after victory on the beaches of D-Day, the allies move into Normandy. Their goal was to seize the city of Caen, but with Germans fighting for every step of countryside, their invasion soon became a nightmare.

episodeList.title: Breakout From Normandy
episodeList.shortDescription: With the fall of Caen, the allies who landed on D-Day were finally able to turn their sights elsewhere. The generals’ next plan was to capture the whole of Normandy, and force the German front lines to retreat.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: With the fall of Caen, the allies who landed on D-Day were finally able to turn their sights elsewhere. The generals’ next plan was to capture the whole of Normandy, and force the German front lines to retreat.

episodeList.title: The Scheldt & Arnheim
episodeList.shortDescription: The allied invasion of Europe was well under way. So far they’d been bombed, picked off by enemy snipers, and slaughtered at the beaches. As they moved farther east, securing supply lines became the difference between victory and desolation.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The allied invasion of Europe was well under way. So far they’d been bombed, picked off by enemy snipers, and slaughtered at the beaches. As they moved farther east, securing supply lines became the difference between victory and desolation.

episodeList.title: Battle of the Bulge
episodeList.shortDescription: As the allies near The Siegfried Line—Germany’s final defensive front—spirits are high. But as they race to Berlin, they are unaware that Hitler has organized a devastating counterattack with his most seasoned troops.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: As the allies near The Siegfried Line—Germany’s final defensive front—spirits are high. But as they race to Berlin, they are unaware that Hitler has organized a devastating counterattack with his most seasoned troops.

episodeList.title: Victory
episodeList.shortDescription: The Siegfried Line has fallen. Nothing stands between the allies and victory in Berlin. But the horrors they uncover in the surrounding countryside leave a bitter taste to the triumph, and bring the true horrors of World War II to light.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Siegfried Line has fallen. Nothing stands between the allies and victory in Berlin. But the horrors they uncover in the surrounding countryside leave a bitter taste to the triumph, and bring the true horrors of World War II to light.

seriesList.title: WWII: Axis vs Allies
seriesList.shortDescription: From 1939-1945 the world was divided into two opposing forces: The Axis Powers and the Allied Forces. The war effort engulfed every aspect of life during the deadliest conflict in human history.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: From 1939-1945 the world was divided into two opposing forces: The Axis Powers and the Allied Forces. The war effort engulfed every aspect of life during the deadliest conflict in human history.

episodeList.title: Fire and Ice
episodeList.shortDescription: This award-winning documentary tells the story of the Soviet Union’s invasion of Finland. Vastly outnumbered and outgunned, Finland’s defenders clung to what hope they could find. Their stoic refusal to surrender changed the course of World War II.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: This award-winning documentary tells the story of the Soviet Union’s invasion of Finland. Vastly outnumbered and outgunned, Finland’s defenders clung to what hope they could find. Their stoic refusal to surrender changed the course of World War II.

episodeList.title: D-Day Invasion Maps
episodeList.shortDescription: A map can be the most powerful weapon a nation can use against its enemies.  See how the maps of WWII played a crucial role in the war, and the incredible measures that were taken to obtain crucial information.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: A map can be the most powerful weapon a nation can use against its enemies.  See how the maps of WWII played a crucial role in the war, and the incredible measures that were taken to obtain crucial information.

episodeList.title: Hitler's Women
episodeList.shortDescription: Women were among the strongest pillars of Hitlerism. While some historians underline the complicity between women and the government, others present them as victims of the Nazis. This film sheds light on the complex relations between Hitler and women.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Women were among the strongest pillars of Hitlerism. While some historians underline the complicity between women and the government, others present them as victims of the Nazis. This film sheds light on the complex relations between Hitler and women.

episodeList.title: D-Day: The Shortest Day
episodeList.shortDescription: Life, said the survivors, was never quite the same again. The Shortest Day documents the meticulous planning leading up to the world’s biggest amphibious invasion, the terror and triumph of the landings and the bitterness of the fighting in the days that
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Life, said the survivors, was never quite the same again. The Shortest Day documents the meticulous planning leading up to the world’s biggest amphibious invasion, the terror and triumph of the landings and the bitterness of the fighting in the days that followed.

episodeList.title: Mendelssohn, The Nazis and Me
episodeList.shortDescription: This film by Felix Mendelssohn’s descendant tells the extraordinary story of what happened, generations after Mendelssohn’s life, to his family and music when the Nazis remembered the Jewish roots of Germany’s most celebrated composer.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: This film by Felix Mendelssohn’s descendant tells the extraordinary story of what happened, generations after Mendelssohn’s life, to his family and music when the Nazis remembered the Jewish roots of Germany’s most celebrated composer.

episodeList.title: Sea of Death
episodeList.shortDescription: 20,000 German civilians lost their lives when Soviet submarines torpedoed three refugee ships in the Baltic sea at the end of the WWII. We go beneath the waves to view the wrecks of the Wilhelm Gustloff, Steuben and Goya and hear the survivors' stories.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: 20,000 German civilians lost their lives when Soviet submarines torpedoed three refugee ships in the Baltic sea at the end of the WWII. We go beneath the waves to view the wrecks of the Wilhelm Gustloff, Steuben and Goya and hear the survivors' stories.

episodeList.title: The Secret D-Day Disaster Revealed
episodeList.shortDescription: How did a rehearsal for D-Day on a sleep British coast result in the death of hundreds of Allied soldiers? Survivor and eye-witness accounts, top-secret documents, and new evidence help reveal the secrecy around “Exercise Tiger” that persists to this day.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: How did a rehearsal for D-Day on a sleepy British coast result in the death of hundreds of Allied soldiers? Survivor and eye-witness accounts, top-secret documents, and new evidence help reveal the secrecy around “Exercise Tiger” that persists to this day.

episodeList.title: The Bombing of Darwin
episodeList.shortDescription: The bombing of Darwin by the Japanese during WWII was the only time Australia has ever faced war on its own soil. But in the midst of chaos, a government cover-up hid the devastation from the public eye.  Discover the truth behind the Bombing of Darwin.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The bombing of Darwin by the Japanese during WWII was the only time Australia has ever faced war on its own soil. But in the midst of chaos, a government cover-up hid the devastation from the public eye.  Discover the truth behind the Bombing of Darwin.

episodeList.title: Wellington Bomber
episodeList.shortDescription: At the height of Bomber Command’s attempts to batter Nazi Germany into submission in 1943, the RAF and the War Ministry came up with a propaganda wheeze: Could a Wellington bomber be built from scratch in a single day?
episodeList.uniqueDescription: At the height of Bomber Command’s attempts to batter Nazi Germany into submission in 1943, the RAF and the War Ministry came up with a propaganda wheeze: Could a Wellington bomber be built from scratch in a single day?

episodeList.title: Spell Your Name
episodeList.shortDescription: Presented by Victor Pinchuk and Steven Spielberg, Spell Your Name follows three journalism students as they relive survivor stories from the Ukraine during the Holocaust; stories of people plunged to the darkest depths of human endurance and hopelessness.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Presented by Victor Pinchuk and Steven Spielberg, Spell Your Name follows three journalism students as they relive survivor stories from the Ukraine during the Holocaust; stories of people plunged to the darkest depths of human endurance and hopelessness.

seriesList.title: Mao's China
seriesList.shortDescription: For over fifty years, the Chinese army guarded a top-secret film record of the Cold War. Now, this film showcases front line footage, combined with first-person accounts, revealing the secret conflicts the Red Army fought and won from behind the Iron Curt

seriesList.title: Voyage of Darwin's Beagle
seriesList.shortDescription: Darwin circumnavigated the earth on the clipper ‘Beagle’, making discoveries that changed our ideas of time, space, chance, sex and nature. His great-great-granddaughter repeats this epic expedition to find out how Darwin's world has changed.
seriesList.uniqueDescription: In 1831, the young naturalist Charles Darwin set sail on one of the most important scientific journeys ever made. Over the course of five years, Darwin circumnavigated the earth on the clipper ‘Beagle’, making discoveries that changed our ideas of time, space, chance, sex and nature. Almost 180 years later, his great-great-granddaughter Sarah Darwin and British author Redmond O’Hanlon repeat this epic expedition to find out how Darwin's world has changed.

episodeList.title: The Last Frontier
episodeList.shortDescription: In this episode, Sarah Darwin visits the last remaining members of a native tribe that was wiped out by European disease.  Hear the history of the Beagle's incredible nautical resilience.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: In this episode, Sarah Darwin visits the last remaining members of a native tribe that was wiped out by European disease.  Hear the history of the Beagle's incredible nautical resilience.

episodeList.title: Low Life on the Ladder of God
episodeList.shortDescription: Follow the team down the coast of South America and see some of the most impacting remnants of the slave trade.  Then, tread in Darwin’s footsteps as he discovers his first giant fossils, proving the existence of ancient and extinct animals.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Follow the team down the coast of South America and see some of the most impacting remnants of the slave trade.  Then, tread in Darwin’s footsteps as he discovers his first giant fossils, proving the existence of ancient and extinct animals.

episodeList.title: One Small Step for Man
episodeList.shortDescription: Almost 180 years after Charles Darwin’s journey around the world, his great granddaughter and a crew of authors, artists, and scientists follow in his footsteps. The first leg of their journey takes them from Tenerife to the rainforests of the Amazon.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: Almost 180 years after Charles Darwin’s journey around the world, his great granddaughter and a crew of authors, artists, and scientists follow in his footsteps. The first leg of their journey takes them from Tenerife to the rainforests of the Amazon.

episodeList.title: The Final Countdown
episodeList.shortDescription: The clipper crosses the Strait of Magellan. Redmond examines the value of salmon farms, while Sarah retraces Darwin’s journey into the Andes Mountains—an expedition he considered to be one of the highlights of his five year voyage.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The clipper crosses the Strait of Magellan. Redmond examines the value of salmon farms, while Sarah retraces Darwin’s journey into the Andes Mountains—an expedition he considered to be one of the highlights of his five year voyage.

episodeList.title: The Paradise of Competition
episodeList.shortDescription: The Stad Amsterdam reaches the Galapagos Islands—the site of Darwin’s most famous research. Explore the various islands with Redmond and Sarah, and meet some of their famous reptilian and feathered inhabitants.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The Stad Amsterdam reaches the Galapagos Islands—the site of Darwin’s most famous research. Explore the various islands with Redmond and Sarah, and meet some of their famous reptilian and feathered inhabitants.

episodeList.title: Toolbox of Survival
episodeList.shortDescription: The crew makes for Australia to examine the profound effect that human habitation—and the introduction of invasive species—has had on the island. They are also confronted with the reality of how climate change has impacted the land and its inhabitants.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: The crew makes for Australia to examine the profound effect that human habitation—and the introduction of invasive species—has had on the island. They are also confronted with the reality of how climate change has impacted the land and its inhabitants.

episodeList.title: Adapt or Die!
episodeList.shortDescription: In this episode, Sarah and Redmond explore how Australia is helping to shape the future of mankind through gene research and artificial intelligence. They look into changes in the Earth’s temperature over the past 50,000 years.
episodeList.uniqueDescription: In this episode, Sarah and Redmond explore how Australia is helping to shape the future of mankind through gene research and artificial intelligence. They look into changes in the Earth’s temperature over the past 50,000 years.

episodeList.title: The Ruins of Progress
episodeList.shortDescription: The Stad Amsterdam’s eight-month journey comes to an end. During this final leg, the crew stops at The Cape of Good Hope. While there, they study mischievous baboons, examine the remnants of apartheid, and meet the San—the oldest race in the world.
